alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 30 at 2:51PM EDT until March 31 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. The heaviest snow will fall in the higher terrain areas west of Marquette and east of Harvey. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph especially near the Lake Superior shoreline. * WHERE...Marquette County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 5 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice and wet snow. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
